alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Laramie County; East Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 4:49PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Scotts Bluff, northwestern Kimball, western Banner, southern Goshen, northeastern Laramie and southeastern Platte Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 449 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Whitaker to 8 miles north of Albin. Movement was northwest at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... La Grange, Chugwater, Albin, Hawk Springs Campground, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Meriden Rest Area, Gun Barrel, Hawk Springs and Slater. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 49 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
